rdEYQqJ1ah7PgfFXbY-7oA.text: We had purchased a living social for Shun Lee since we just moved to the Cotswold area.  But then read these reviews and were a bit scared to try.  Well i gotta say we tried tonight and it was really good.  It is a hidden gem.  The food was excellent, the service was great.  We had a spicy entree and a sweet one.  SO good.  My husbannd and I will be back for sure.  If you are hesitant .. don't be just go try ... :)

ewbjQB4Qwsxqx4UDnjGvRw.text: Food was OK (food temps could be hotter). Clean restaurant. Upholstery was outdated. Service was slowwwwww! There was very few people eating here and only one waitress and what could of been a 30 min experience turned into an hour because of her slow response time. I would come back only if the service was quicker (Which is customary for a Chinese restaurant) and my rice and music soup was hotter!

i3OoQ7xHF8J7enZst2PMxQ.text: Never again.  The $17 Seafood Delight had 3 shrimp & 3 scallops,  The Mongolian Beef had half the amount of beef than our previous visits and was very spicy after I had asked for "little spicy".  The brown rice must have been sitting back there as it was dried out.  The manager gave us a song and dance about rising costs.  No more profit from us.

cYPoe7jUKE5ASaZS1w7QIg.text: Why I like Shun Lee its close to home - I feel like I'm really in a Chinese restaurant if you don't know what that means its traditional to me...elevator music...fish art...fried noodles with duck sauce and spicy mustard when you sit down.  It kind of reminds me of Chinese places I ate at as a kid with my grandparents so for the found memories thank you Shun Lee.    The chinese food is good and what you would expect nothing fancy.  They have recently remodeled part of the restaurant and now offer sushi.  The first time I ordered it I thought it was ok but nothing great - but last nights sushi was very good.  They have a fairly large sushi menu now with some inventive options.  BIG PLUS 30% off sushi - its a promotion going on now till sometime in late November so if you want to check this place out now is a perfect time.  Another plus you can always get a seat at this place.

IbG3KdL0NOUlWC-x69-T8Q.text: I HAVE NOT EATEN AT THE RESTAURANT- HAVE ONLY TRIED THEIR TAKEOUT/PICK-UP. Shun Lee Palace is a little pricey for my taste, for take-out Chinese; granted I am from Philly and have lived in NYC both cities where there are authentic places in suspect corners doling out good ethnic cuisine for next to nothing.  The food is decent. I am sure they use loads of MSG (the effects on my body are recognizable the next morning), and their portions are small. A few entrees, and a quart of wonton soup will run you over 40 dollars. **The sesame chicken and sweet and sour chicken dishes consistently have too much corn starch and batter, respectively. On top of that, the entree is about 20% hard batter/starch MINUS the chicken.     As far as late night in  Myers Park goes, this is the only alternative to pizza that I've found and for that alone it gets another star.

b5mkwv5Z1Kxvk25zqXxnpQ.text: AVOID at all costs!!! Wish I could give it less than 1 star. Just went there this past Thursday to pick up some Chinese to-go and 3 hrs after eating it I had diarrhea and threw up multiple times to the point where there's nothing left in me. It is now Sunday and I still have a sour stomach with diarrhea, hopefully it will be gone by tomorrow. On a better note, atleast I only missed work on Friday and am using the rest of the weekend for rest. Will never go there again. Not sure if it was the "chicken" (if that's really what it is) or the eggroll that caused it, but this meal was the only one I consumed that day and definitely was the cause of the poisoning. Never Again! Stay far away!

z5OOhx0R09qtNgd9A480cA.text: I just ordered delivery from here.  The delivery was quick, but the order was wrong.  I immediately called at 1:35, and the lady on the phone, after initially disagreeing with me, actually read the order and agreed that my order was wrong, and that I'd be welcome to come pick up the missing portions of the order.  I let her know that I was sick in bed, and that's why I ordered delivery from here, and that I would not be getting out to fix their mistake.  She let me know that she would speak to the owner and let me know IF they could bring me the remaining portion.  She called twenty minutes later to let me know that they would bring the remaining portion of my order in 15 minutes, which means that the lunch I paid for will be cold and will have to be heated.  I worked in the service industry during college and graduate school as a waitress and bartender, and I know that easiest thing to do, especially on a slow Tuesday lunch shift, is to make sure that orders are correct.  I will not order delivery from this restaurant again.

r5sRpeXhQj9wgxClIhUPkw.text: Ordered delivery and it was not good. Chicken noodle soup tasted like water. Filet hibachi was over cooked and most of the steak was gristly. So disappointed to spend that much on delivery to not even get a meal I can eat leftovers

6K77i8uKxSCPX4XxOcj9eQ.text: I had a very disappointing experience with a take out order from Shun Lee.  I was surprised that the same entree which I ordered a month or two ago had decreased in volume by about a third.  Plus, it didn't taste as good as the last time I ordered the same entree.    I was even more surprised when the price was two dollars more than the price on the take out order from my last visit.  The friendly woman at the register said that the prices had gone up.  However, when I got home and read the new photocopied take out menu, the price had gone up only twenty five cents from that which was on the menu which I had ordered from.  I think that the quality, quantity and price of Shun Lee have decreased in quality overall since the new owners took over.  I had frequented this restaurant regularly while Frank Lee owned it over the last thirty years.    I will definitely think twice about returning to eat or take out at Shun Lee Palace in the future.

MrVmOwLmCZTtURo2LZDGtA.text: Saturday night date night.  I had gotten take out from Shun Lee once before and enjoyed it so we went back for dinner tonight.  As previous reviews have mentioned the decor is circa 1970 but it gives the place some charm. They do not skimp on the portion sizes or the amount of meat in the dishes. Many other Chinese restaurants over load the veggies without much meat. The sa cha chicken and Mongolian beef could have been spicier.  Overall experience was good and we will be returning again soon.

IfSzyf7_r4WJK9uISQZmFQ.text: I've been going to Shun Lee Palace for more than 20 years.  Its just a few blocks from my grandmothers house and she was always a fan.  The place was purchased by new owners a couple of years ago and while the food is still pretty good, the service is...spotty at best.  I think they try to make due with fewer servers than they should have so once you place your order, you never see them until they drop off your food and then you are on your own again until the check comes.  If something is wrong or if you need something extra (more to drink, etc.)...too bad.

-3b68flUaiVBdTHB5Le4BA.text: Had lunch here today.  This was my second visit.  Pluses are very friendly staff.  Patrons seem to be regulars as most are greeted warmly and some by name (and most of the patrons seemed to know the staff by name).  Service was very fast and food is served hot.  Our table had the sweet and sour chicken (diner complimented the generous portion but she's a light eater), the spicy chicken and chinese eggplant (almost too spicy for our spice-loving guest and the eggplant looked a bit slimy - diner kept referring to it as the unidentified "fish" in the dish) and chicken chow mein (lots of lettuce and veggies in the chow mein, I should have ordered the sesame chicken).  We all ordered hot tea - hey, it was chilly today! - and the server brought a large pot to the table that lasted us the entire meal.  Prices are fair - $5-7 for lunch entrees that come with fried rice and egg roll.  But the food just isn't memorable for me.  It's merely okay if I'm in the neighborhood but not worth a trip from anywhere for me.  Lunchtime clientele seemed to be 65% retirees and 35% local business people/office workers/realtors.

U3shP3z2UmJyHN6oMOETuA.text: Haven't eaten here in years and decided to try it again since I was working on this side of town. This place isn't what it use to be. It looks the same, but the food is different and the staff aren't very helpful or friendly. Some other post indicated the original owner had sold and you can tell.

gcvelOyr0KTCctdwqn5yyA.text: not sure whats going on,, the place seems very tattered now,  and the food quality has seem to gone way down,, Michael is doing his best I know but sometimes you need to step back and figure out whats wrong :(

ZMAsR5l_Dm3HBtloRjV4fw.text: This is my place to go when I'm in the mood for Chinese food and it's not just because it's convenient relative to where I currently live. I used to live in the University Area and would trek down to Shun Lee for special occasion dinners. This is where my now-husband and I had our first official date many years ago and where we went the night he proposed. We don't keep going for sentiment, but for the food. My favorite dish is the beef with broccoli mainly because the brown sauce they use is delicious and the broccoli is fresh. My husband enjoys their general tsos chicken, paper shrimp, wontons, and chicken with broccoli. His brothers really enjoy their hibachi dishes. If you enjoy vegetables, the hibachi dishes are a very good deal. We go there often enough that there have been a few off nights, but their off nights have been very few and far between for us. We both dine in and do take out. We do both lunch and dinner. One dish I haven't had much luck with is an appetizer, their bbq spare ribs. They're flavorless except for the oil they're cooked with. I haven't had much luck with bbq regular or boneless spare ribs in Chinese restaurants around town anyway so it's not a deal breaker by any means. The service can be hit or miss depending on which severs you have, how well they're staffed that day, and how new the staff is. Some days you may have to grab several different servers as they dash around to get what you need, but they're typically eager to please and easy to work with.

NbAUNi79X0F2o3T1Iiud2Q.text: This is another place that I've been frequenting since I was a little girl...  until now...  I've sworn to never return.  When Frank sold it to this new owner, it's been a steady downhill slide in terms of service, portion size and taste.  I could overlook most things, and was even embracing the addition of a sushi bar, but the service is HORRIBLE!  don't think you're ever going to get more drinks, because it's simply not going to happen.  And don't think that mentioning the lack of service to the management is going to help anything, because it won't.  Just move along to the next chinese place and don't look back.

QuehQLTYNXFTbqECZtQISw.text: Fortunately, I had a coupon for this place or otherwise I would have stuck with my instincts and continued to avoid Shun Lee Palace as I have for the 30 years I have lived in the Cotswold area.  Nothing could have prepared me for this experience as I operate on the assumption that at worse, the food at Shun Lee Palace would be edible...NOT!!  I ordered several things for me and my family to try focusing mostly on appetizers as they SHOULD be the hardest things to get wrong: two of the steamed appetizers, egg drop soup, spring rolls, crab rangoons and an entree, Sesame Chicken.  Pretty straightfoward fare that you can basically find at any Chinese spot in America, right?  Not the case at Shun Lee Palace!  The steamed pork dumplings were slightly savory although dish presentation was horrible; it made the food less appealing to the eye.  The other steamed appettizer, shrimp dumplings were odd-shapped bite-sized nuggets but they lacked any flavor...even shrimp which makes me question the contents of the translucent nuggets.  The soup also lacked flavor and the spring roll did not contain any meat just barely heated shredded cabbage and carrots.  Now to the biggest travesty of the evening:  the Sesame Chicken.  While the chicken was sliced as indicated in the menu description, it was neither crispy or flavorful.  It was simply disgusting.  The chicken which appeared to be poached was floating in a sacharrine-sweet brown sauce with sesame seeds tossed in for good measure.  There was no broccoli in the dish and the overall presentation of the dish was poorly executed.  In all candor, it did not resemble in taste or physical appearance, the very traditional dish of Sesame Chicken.  In Shun Lee Palace's defense, the night we ordered food from them was their busy night.  I assume for take out or delivery because that fact was not represented in the dining room with maybe 6 tables being served while we were in there.  I gave this place a chance but there will be no other chances.  It was easily the worst Chinese food I have ever had!

F7WR8d2undo6peabUMdesw.text: Sadly, Shun Lee is really going downhill. It used to be one of the best Chinese restaurants in Charlotte. I have been going there for over 30 years and have noticed the general decline. I ate there a few weeks ago and it wasn't good. I hoped it was just a fluke but then tonight we had Generals Tso's chicken and it was horrible - no flavor at all. I won't be back.

j6_Q95dD4TZ4HOehTvHchw.text: Shun Lee was the best place in town to get Chinese food 10 years ago.  Now, the food there is the same, but the competition has really increased.  Their food is fine, good even, but certainly nothing special.  They have a large menu, which is nice, and a large restaurant so you don't have to wait.  If you live near Shun Lee it might be the place for you because they remember their regulars and have a great family run establishment.  If you want to try something that is a little fresher, I recommend trying Baoding (Southpark), DragonFly (Park Rd/ Myers Park), or HoHo (Dilworth).

srkfgCUltsNdnlFSEul8Eg.text: This was my favorite Chinese place in Charlotte. Their sesame chicken is unlike any other kinds I've tasted. This place is under new management recently and I'm still happy with all the service and the food. The new renovations look great as well.

40N44gb4ySYNuvWzOh4Aqg.text: RELAX... do not be scared of those negative reviews. They must have their purpose... I too was afraid to try UNTIL an encourage off one of reviewer Margaret L - Charlotte, NC.  She was right.  I've ordered cocount shrimp entree - man!!! IT's tasty! Rice? Not even so "sticky" just the right kind of "sticky" rice... Jasmine, I think.  I also ordered wonton soup - it scores high score.  And these were take-out - they were very good!  One more thing... they accidentally switched my order with something else but they were very very helpful and corrected their mistake quickly.  Would give it a five but I'm saving it for the next time I get to DINE in. :)  Just go... try take-out first.  Worth your $ and time.

9vLw5LqFPSGmLh8FIoXkJQ.text: Unfortunately this place was not good. I hate to give a bad review because the people were nice but it is what it is. First of all the decor is extremely outdated. The big tall leather booths and the plastic  tablecloths made me feel like I was in the Scarface movie. I was just waiting for Al Pacino to come out in a polyester suit. This immediately took away from my dining experience. We ordered shrimp egg foo young and shrimp fried rice, both which were mediocre at best. The gravy had no flavor and the rice had very little. I also tried shrimp dumpling which were just ok.I had to bring most of it home to try to doctor it up just so it wouldn't go to waste. We even tried the fortune cookies and they were so stale I had to spit it out. We had a coupon which is why we tried it but we won't be back.

yx6R0ADoJvL6C3uAQGeACg.text: I was excited to check this place out since it looks so authentic and old school Chinese. Most places with decor like this have great well known food. Got the beef and broccoli, an order of chicken wings and egg drop soup. All average at best. Food doesn't match the restaurant's look and atmosphere. Disappointing. Wouldn't recommend it if you're looking for good Chinese.

bDHLa67WRQ-C6RGWqkQ_Og.text: We eat here weekly. We have our favorite dishes but when we do try something new it is always delicious! Customer service gets 2 thumbs up. The owner is super nice and always comes by to chat with us. Our favorite dishes are the cilantro curry shrimp, sub gum wanton soup, shrimp fried rice..... and sesame chicken- always super yummy!   Its always nice when you walk into a facility and they welcome you by name. We love Shun Lee Palace!

LCrWDtVV8H3nhm0NSxpUOg.text: Hello, 1980s!  Stepping into Shun Lee Palace is like stepping back in time.  The colors of Mauve and Hunter Green abound in the decor.  And lets not forget the swivel chairs.    We went on a Saturday night and were seated immediately.  Like someone else mentioned in their review, it was mostly an "older" crowd.  (Perhaps they've been there since the 80s?)   It took quite some time before we were greeted by our server and quite a time longer before she returned to take our orders.    I like to think that I know my way around a Chinese restaurant, but there were dishes on the menu with which I was not familiar.  And, unfortunately, there were no descriptions.  Tai Chi?  Tung Ann?  New Tze?  Flower Chicken?  Royal Chicken?  Peacock Chicken?  I asked our server about two of them, but didn't want to ask any further and went with Sa Cha Chicken because I knew I had had it someplace once before.  The food came out as it was made.  First, two (of five) dinners were brought out, one of which had to be taken back because it was wrong.  Then that second one returned with the correct entree.  Then a third dinner came out.  And then finally, the fourth and fifth together.  The food was enjoyable, but a bit on the bland side.  If my entree has a little mark next to it because it's spicy, I want it spicy.  Unfortunately, it wasn't.  And there was nothing on the table to doctor it up.  Everything tasted very fresh, though, so kudos for that.  And the kids' entrees were pretty big, so they were a good value.    I'm wary of Chinese restaurants that don't automatically offer you chopsticks.   I like chopsticks.  I like to eat Chinese, Japanese, Thai, and sushi dinners with chopsticks.  It adds to the experience.  Since we rarely saw our server, I didn't even bother to ask for a pair.  Maybe there was a shortage in the 1980s?    I'm sure some people have been going to Shun Lee Palace since they decorated in the 1980s and love it.  I, for one, have experienced much better.  Much, MUCH better.  Atmosphere is a big deal for me.  Shun Lee didn't have it, so we won't be going back.    p.s. What's up with the clothing rack in the dining room?  You might think it was for people to hang their coats; however, you'd be wrong.  Apparently it's a rack where the employees can hang their street clothes up during their shifts.  (Because I doubt that anyone took off their T-shirts at dinner because they were too hot.)  Tres tacky.

9I8lXvtbja9IqoDb7RjZvQ.text: Don't come to Shun Lee looking for new and trendy. Come for old school Asian American Chinese. We tried it for the first time tonight, and throughly enjoyed our meal. We started with the hot and sour soup. It was lighter like I like it w/o being heavy on the soy. It was topped with lots of chopped scallions - a plus! We then moved on to Beef with Black Pepper and Kung Pao Chicken. My favorite was the beef. I think I tasted a little sherry in addition to the peppery goodness? Oh, and the server was attentive and before we left some other guy came and thanked us. It was a pleasant Sunday evening experience.

m-2hWBtesvLznCsHsLASzg.text: I've been going to Shun Lee Palace for 25 years. When the new ownership took over the few years ago, things went downhill quickly. Last night, I thought I'd give shun Lee another chance. I was disappointed in the small portions, limited chicken in the dish and micro sized egg roll and spring roll. My bill was $27 for two small portion dishes which I thought was outrageous. I will never go here again. So much better when Frank owned and ran the restaurant.

izXV8yW8vZDL73msijH7uw.text: I had Shun Lee years ago and just went back recently--I had the vegetable fried rice and my boyfriend had the tofu. I assumed he like his; he ate it all.  The fried rice was as expected, so I have no complaints.  It's a hop from my house so I may just go back a little more often.  It's back in the cut, so you gotta make sure you turn onto Colwick and it's all the way in the back past the Krispy Kreme and Domino's.

gNoGCHA63DOT_Htpa02doA.text: Bad Chinese food. Came highly recommended by someone who had been there many many years ago. Things have changed. We ordered all over the map...tofu, chicken. seafood, noodles...everything was bland and low quality. Avoid at all costs.

CMGp-mCknPxdJzpSkDQ9Sw.text: Just tried Shun Lee Palace and I must say it was crazy good.  Service was excellent and the food was some of the best I have eaten in Charlotte.  Highly recommend.

4tY5rI6DpmPMj_ZGvH0FNA.text: I went with a couple of girlfriends to eat dinner over the weekend.  One said her son and daughter-in-law had found this place.  We laughed because my friend and I had gone many years ago and just haven't been back.  We thought we'd give it another try and now we know why we haven't been back.  It was awful!!  The food was not good at all!  They only serve vegetable egg rolls, nothing with meat. The service was even worse.  It took our waitress forever to wait on us (they weren't busy at all which is another bad sign) and then when we did order our drinks it took 15 minutes or longer to get them, including a bottled beer!  The manager came by our table and asked if we needed anything and we said our drinks and he said she's making them now.  You don't have a bartender?  You and your wife or someone else stand up there behind the bar doing absolutely nothing!  The food was absolutely terrible!  Next time I'll go to Baoding where I know the food is good!  Don't recommend this restaurant at all.  Don't waste your time.

amOPdrLDn-H_nq9xR9t7EQ.text: This used to be a good place and now it's changed for the worst. My most recent 'dissatisfactory moment', but not the only, was this weekend when I ordered take out from Shun Lee and they force an 18% tip upon my bill. No one brought me anything, there was no delivery, I didn't even ask anyone for extra sauce so why is there a tip on my bill?!?  I won't be coming back anymore and I advice any NEW or 'before the changes' customers to do the same.

jLK5c7Xd57PygiEHaHnMrg.text: Went there tonight they are not interested in catering to dietary needs such as not using vegetable oil and using the organic olive oil that I have brought with me.  I don't think they are up with the times when some people are focused on their health as some other restaurants are.  So we ended up leaving and going to The Great Wall of China where they have and did cater to or dietary needs.  Another place that has also done so is Thai Taste in Matthews.  The reason the restaurants use vegetable oil is that it's the cheapest one to use even those it's bad for you heart wise.  I don't blame them but at least if a customer request and brings their own oil use it.

08qNkTsYTDiXkk_JJObXEw.text: I feel like the quality of this place has gone downhill slightly over the years. More globbed on sauces and general blandness. Meh.

kJfxtHJsPGILi2cogpdjOg.text: Yep, I see the reviewer before me used the phrase "hidden gem." I'm a little pissed, since that's the phrase I wanted to use. We went to eat here with friends last night, and I was impressed by the food, the service, and the environment for somewhere that looked like such a hole-in-the-wall.   I ordered the Szechuan Eggplant, and it was really good. There was plenty on the plate, too, so I took leftovers to work today for lunch. The couple who took us there wanted the spicy green beans, and although the restaurant had sold out of green beans, the manager went to the Harris Teeter around the corner to grab some for us. Even with the little hiccup, the food was ready quick, and it was all delicious.  My only complaint is that the vegetarian selection is a little skimpy...there were 3 or 4 things on the menu, which isn't bad, but usually a Chinese restaurant will have lots of options.

9JTFrrAfR_KsgLun16ULuQ.text: Ate here again Thursday night - had the broccoli in hot garlic sauce. Was good (again, wish it were spicier so I should ask next time) but I loved the vegetable roll. Please do not be put off by some of the negative reviews. I enjoyed my second time here and intend to make semi-regular visits as I live nearby.

yqyPDwwY_dMNm2iTBPAodw.text: Buyer beware.  The service (by our lead waiter) was among the worst we have ever experienced. (Support staff was great, but Waiter was horrible). Went there Sunday night.  Rudest, most disrespectful server I've ever had. Tossing food on the table, reaching over my plate to fill water for someone else, taking food away before we were done. He had a huge chip on his shoulder, I'd say more like a boulder.  He was so unpleasant (borderline angry) and he ruined our dining experience.  He should not be working with the public.  I have never publicly written a bad review, because its just not my style but this experience was simply dreadful. I'm sorry to say we will not be back.

imtkUa-TDQdaU8wuSnNvXg.text: The waiter was very unhelpful. Considering this was my first visit to the restaurant, I asked for some suggestions but got the response "there are not many choices for vegetarians" and then he walked away. I proceeded to leave the restaurant. Horrible service.

6hdUvI1aYAg8Hu0JK5unZA.text: My recent visits have shown that Shun Lee folks are happy I have come. Food is consistent. Definitely better than some other Chinese restaurants in the area.

qA5FZshwCt8EwLjJ6ofdIw.text: I've heard a lot of mix reviews about this place through the years. So I finally decided to try it out for myself a few weeks ago and been wanting to come write a review. I LOVE Chinese food so when I went in to order carry out I decided to pick some of my regular dishes to try.   The customer service wasn't very great to begin with. The lady wasn't very friendly and helpful in suggesting any special dish. Here are my reviews on the dishes that I did buy.   Pork Fried Rice - It was blah! There was no flavor to the rice but oil.   General Tso Chicken - It was blah too!! Barely any flavors  House Special Lo Mein - This one taste a lot better than the other two dishes, but was just okay for me too.   The only dish I did like was their Beef, Shrimp and Scallop stir fry dish, but none of the dishes really screamed that I will be visiting again next time!   My husband did mention that they have Japanese and sushi on their menu also so I would still like to go back to try this part of their menu out, but will not be going back there for Chinese food.

29N44SzyIj9SqQm-ODLt7Q.text: I have been going to Shun Lee since i was a little kid, when Frank owned the place. I've given it a few chances in the last couple years under new ownership and it's just not the same.  The beef and broccoli didn't have as much richness and flavor as it once did and my friend got the King Pao chicken and it too was quite bland.  I might give it one more shot since it's so close to my house, but dang, i was pretty disappointed this last time.

qecx6FcHbHOX1ws7ibue9g.text: The food was awful and when talked to the manager/owners about it ..he didnt care about it..he continue to ask me if i wanted to take it home

GdjxWRd7751yQD4dpiQGXw.text: I love this place! They are so friendly, helpful and always deliver super quickly!

jsCa-KOpo_MupFUOE2IEWQ.text: My boyfriend took me to this place and we dined in. When we ate at the restaurant there was only one other couple that was eating there too. The waiters that are here are really adamant about getting you out quickly. There is no sense to just sit here and enjoy your food you are consistently rushed. So now I go and order over the phone and pick up when the food is ready. But every time I am coming to pick up my food to go the managers always complaining how there is no one it's it's in the restaurant and how he has to send employees home because he has no one to serve. It's quite irritating to come in here and hear them all complaining. Despite the bad attitudes that resign in this building the food is pretty good

y-oQqscq0nCdpj8BJNe7Ew.text: Super bummed that this wasn't good. I was hoping to find a new "hidden gem" like Chad E. had written 4 years ago, but instead, I found a place that I will not return to.   For as lousy as the quality of the food was, the service was pretty good. We were promptly greeted and were seated immediately. I was surprised to see as many patrons dining in there as there were. Many of the patrons were seniors, next middle-aged (40s), and then a couple younger people.  We left discontent because the veggie lo mein noodles were oily and limp and the Mongolian beef was fatty. The server forgot our rice until we asked for it. I would compare the food similar to mall food or Chinese food at a buffet that has been sitting out a while. I don't mean to sound too critical, but the quality was so bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States

4Q1Ha3ESCXU-2boUl10LtQ.text: This place, hands down, had the worst customer service I have EVER experienced. I ended up ordering take out from here right before they closed for the night. I got home opened up my Singapore rice noodles and there were onions all throughout the plate (asked please don't add onions bc I am highly allergic, also stated on the receipt). I then proceeded to put the chicken and broccoli on my plate, there laid a LONG strand of hair that genetically could not have belonged to me. I took a picture of the hair in he food and threw my plate away. I ended up going back to shun Lee palace the following day after I got off work (since they were closed by the time I got home that night and they weren't open when I left for work. The manager assist me as soon as I approached the counter. I had the entire order of food and laid it on the counter as well as the picture to explain what happened. The manager told me he could only give me the money for the onions in the noodles because i presented evidence but because I couldn't produce the hair (which was thrown away in disgust) he refused to give me the money back. I asked him one more time if he felt that was excellent customer service. He was pretty much screaming at me at this point in time saying I could call the police if I wanted to but he wasn't giving me my money back. He completely embarrassed me infringed of his staff as well as the customers. Needless to say I will NEVER EVER go back there if that's how he treats his customers for an issue that wasn't their fault.

photos.caption: Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States

ibomnwi_LfCoH1Uhjxv5kA.text: It's extremely difficult to find good Chinese food in Charlotte, but this place makes the cut. I tried the orange chicken and it was pleasantly sweet and spicy with a very pleasant orange flavor. The chicken was  high quality and the presentation visually appealing. I was impressed by the generous portion sizes as well as the dedicated staff. I'll certainly be back.

-0NOEGwUJGQ9IBA_saPgyA.text: I met someone here for lunch and thought I would write a review upon entering the restaurant we were quickly greeted and were seated promptly I ordered a chicken stir fry egg plant dish and substituted the chicken for tofu and the egg roll for a spring roll without meat the portions were decent and the prices are reasonable but the food was bland . They are vegan/ vegetarian friendly though and were more than happy to accommodate my dietary needs.

photos.caption: Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tofu eggplant dish!

pYApkDIl08gshRKxXSGMaQ.text: Ordered takeout, no big deal. Except that they added over $6 worth of charges to my card for absolutely no reason. Couldn't give an explanation and gave me the runaround before finally settling. Never again. Mediocre sorta Chinese food isn't worth  $30 and terrible customer service. Unless tiny, shriveled chicken and dry tastless rice is your thing - go elsewhere.

CKYAJVKuVd983npOWAtb2g.text: I have been getting food from here for years on account of how close it is to my home. I used to really like it, but the food quality has gone downhill. The last few times I ordered from here, the food was atrocious. Menu items don't taste fresh and the dishes are not up to par. The fried rice hardly tastes fried. It is like white rice with veggies mixed in. The pan fried dumplings are limp, like pulled from a freezer and microwaved.  The lo mein tastes like old noodles soaked in soy sauce. It pains me to write a poor review, but I won't be back.

jaUiqQoYgxGmG79ka-rSQA.text: Good traditional food.  This is my go-to place for delivery/take out and also when I want a quiet meal to myself.  Great people, although the "ambiance" is basic Asian restaurant.  Not outrageously expensive either.  Definitely recommend.

BgTMsw-X7Aq_yStvivROHg.text: I come here for their Hot and Sour soup. It is delightful and near perfection. It is so tasty!!! The service has been relatively quick as I'm on my lunch break when I usually stop in. It's around my work so it's quite convenient to stop in and I know I'll be served and treated well. Thank you!

ydu_M0yFwqw2LJkUWyMjNA.text: Wow. This may be the worst Chinese meal I've ever had. It makes me sad to post this review. This place was once the go-to old school Chinese place. Now there is nothing to recommend it. Food was terrible. Service was good but not good enough to overcome the poor food quality.

9cQxFuRTGwpTAdMtijrVaQ.text: it satisfies the craving but delivery is slow. if you want spicy, you gotta ask for extra super spicy, or you will hardly taste it. I got crab rangoon, and they had only mayo in them. I called to inquire, and I asked if there wasn't supposed to be crab in them. she laughed and said "no". guess thats just how they make them but every other place I've had them at has crab and cheese.  I may still order when I'm too lazy to leave the house and craving chines, but definitely not my first choice.

sAAw0i1anUOZswCfmgnWdw.text: I have been coming to this restaurant for over 15 years. This is the best authentic chinese restaurant in Charlotte NC that I have eaten at so far and I have tried most of them. I love their fried rice and fried chicken wings. I had a party of 17 people there yesterday to celebrate my birthday. The waiter had an awesome personality and even let me know when my 8 year old  asked for a 3rd refill on her caffeinated beverage. The manager was nice enough to work with us through an issue with confusion about their coupon policy. Most of my party was family from out of town and they said that they loved it and want to come back when they are in town. Everyone should try them out because the food is ao good.

_XGqJn5YWN1nQEAZqUsNgA.text: Still the best in Charlotte since the day they opened. Have been a loyal customer of this place since Frank opened it in the late 70's if I am not mistaken. Now owned by Jason and his wife they have kept the tradition alive and even improved it over time. The food is always the best, and the service spot on. When I want to eat Chinese, I go here.

oJPYFgvNCRabLHcks28e0A.text: The customer service in this place is horrible.  The people look miserable in there, and the food is mediocre.  And if you are Asian you will know that their "Bubble tea" is just fruity liquid that isn't even blended with ice and is straight powder water.  Here's a tip, learn how to have some customer service skills if you're going to run a restaurant.

YYQjXEVperVb0MkevStmyw.text: I've had food from Shun Lee since I was a kid. If you are looking for a new take on american chinese cuisine, it's not gonna wow you, but if you like old school style, it's the place for you. I personally love the Royal Chicken. The menu has good variety and I've yet to be disappointed by their food yet. If you are in the area, give it a shot. It might just surprise you.

O2nOQp265ewOmiAk5lXMVg.text: Shun Lee Palace has been around since I was a little girl. The interior has changed, but not much. The koi painting that I always loved is still there. You no longer walk through a beaded curtain to use the restroom though, which I always thought was so cool!  The food and service is good. The prices are great. I love the Wonton soup. You can order a Wonton Soup for 2 for under $7.00. Order it to go and you have enough soup to make a couple of meals off of it. Some of my favorite entrees are the sizzling three delights and shrimp with Chinese eggplant. These portions are always large enough for my husband and I to share.   A delicious dinner for two with appetizers and wine under $30.00....tell me what is not awesome about that?  To satisfy those Chinese cravings, go check out Shun Lee Palace.

pvRU4gVaNWV1KSrbBEUrqw.text: LOVE shun lee! Yes the decor is kinda funky but it's charming in a way. The service is hit or miss since you can be served by no less then three servers, kinda confusing if you ask me. Food is solid 5 stars though, love getting take out, never have received anything wrong. Some favorites are Singaporean rice noodles, coconut shrimp, honey peach chicken.

LaahSK011b-w7desfSNAug.text: Shrimp with eggplant is the best I've ever had! Perfectly spicy salty sweet umami!! Yummmy!

photos.caption: Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States

D8qxAWM5rOSKyLI22YpvIA.text: So, it has been years since I have been to Shun Lee but was told by a friend it had been renovated and was really good. So, I decided to check them out again. And, yes, the restaurant has been renovated and looks much better than it did years ago, but the food was horrible.  I started with a spring roll and wonton soup. The spring roll was nothing great, but at least warm and not greasy. However, the soup, blah again. No flavor in the broth what so ever and the wonton was nasty, almost frozen like taste. I ordered the chicken and shrimp with mixed veggies for my entree. UGH! Needless to say there was a pull of grease from the brown sauce and the taste of the dish was nothing great.   I think the servers mean well, but when they bring the wrong soup, forget your drink and deliver a dirty glass I pretty much know I am done. Sorry Shun Lee, I won't be back.

5kALVnpejzdfxN1L-Zu3mg.text: The food for me was disappointing. My order was wrongly prepared but they promptly replaced it but alas the Singapore rice noodles tasted raw . Had to leave it and ordered fried rice which was little ok . Anyways by then had lost the appetite . The only thing I liked was chocolate ice cream and when the bill arrived nothing was complimentary. No worries for that but would never visit there again .

1QoIGAWw7mpq4QsBE8RMJg.text: Shun Lee Palace has been my favorite Chinese since I was little. Growing up in the area it has been a go to since day one. We love to dine in or takeout as the environment is extremely inviting. I always order the orange chicken and it's the best in town. Truly authentic Chinese. My family usually gets the spring rolls as an app and someone always gets the sweet and sour chicken. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for good Chinese!

IX7zQ9cailqd9qESnGAOQw.text: Shun lee is like a hidden gem - I accidentally found the restaurant tucked away in the Cotswold neighborhood, and it's honestly one of the best Chinese restaurants I've eaten here in Charlotte. They have a diverse menu for everyone's tastebuds, and the lunch prices are a really good deal for how much food you get!

7M2JijmclLnMEmOmpRzQ7A.text: I should have taken the other ratings seriously. I ordered some food for take out after work.I was very hungry and exhausted. I had eaten there approximately 6 years ago prior and I remember The food being tasty.  Well, what a difference 6 years can make.  The crab rangoon was decent, the pan fried dumplings were barely fried. One of the cooks wasn't sure if the food that someone in the kitchen made ( and was part of my order) was called "Chow mein" or "Chow men". This concerned me a bit, as the it should have( because if you are working there  you should be able pronounce the menu items), because the noodles in the "chow mess " taste like MUSH along with the vegetables ( overcooked).   It's  not how I remember it. And I won't be going back. I only gave it an extra star due to the crab rangoon being o.k.

rRkLFhCoXWlfrBrFyXZQmQ.text: I'm a big fan of Chinese food so when I was visiting my sister and her fiance this past Sunday I suggested Chinese for dinner.  Off we went to Shun Lee.  Apparently this is one of their favorite Chinese spots and it's pretty cute so I can see why.    The decor is traditional with the fish art, random music, and nice leather chairs.  These are pink!  We sat in a booth though.  Immediately we were provided with a complimentary appetizer of fried noodles with duck sauce and spicy mustard.  Seriously spicy mustard!  Our orders were quickly taken although when I specifically asked for lemon with my water that was ignored.  When I asked again, a whole ramekin was produced!    Molly S. ordered us an appetizer of crab rangoons.  My picture is of the remaining four since I neglected to take a picture until after two had been consumed.  Her fiancee also ordered some hot and sour soup and an egg roll.    I don't remember what Molly ordered, but her fiancee ordered this mound of rice with a variety of things in it -- eggs, some vegetables, pork, shrimp, and maybe beef.  I'd never seen such a thing.  It was cool!  This is where my review takes a hit.  They didn't have my favorite Kung Pao chicken.  So I kinda picked something random.  New Tze Chicken.  Next time I'll ask for a comparable selection to Kung Pao chicken.  According to the description on the menu, it has lightly fried chicken tenders, carrots, broccoli, and is served in a sauce with rice.  I thought it would have some spice element to it as well, but I must have misunderstood.  The dish was good, but I felt it was a little too sweet and the chicken was breaded just a little too much for my taste.    I must say that the service was very good though.  We were looked after, drinks refilled, and fried noodles were replenished.  One of our servers, seems they tag-team it, looked and sounded just like Jackie Chan too.  Not kidding.  I think if I ended up going back here, since Molly and her fiance seem to like it so much, I would just ask for help in ordering.  Looking at their website, it's pretty neat that you can place your order online for pickup or express dining too.

photos.caption: Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States. New Tze Chicken 3/16/14
Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States. The four remaining Crab Rangoons of six total 3/16/14
Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Noodles, duck sauce, and watch the spicy mustard! 3/16/14

oCtXLnIRKBNAbXuwJgYR5g.text: Everything I had to eat was excellent. The Beef lo mein was some of the best I've ever had. I would have given it a 4 star but they lose a point because the waitress was slow, she simply forgot about us the whole night. I don't like having to ask for a refill. But again, the food we had was all so great. I would definitely return again and again.

FuTsP_Db5HxjGg6W19s2Cw.text: Love this place! Been here many times and will be going back many more. Tried something different tonight. Lettuce wraps, my new favorite. Chen is a great waiter.The wonton soup was the best I've had and the fried wontons and homemade duck sauce was good enough to ask for extra to go. Great food great value.

2h0V-KFJhUhpIgqW70VqNw.text: Quick and easy place to get a business lunch.  I ate here recently during a prospecting day with a sales partner.  I had the "hibachi lunch special" and it was perfect.  We were in and out very quickly and already planned our next meeting for here.

fCYTjYOfAYw86QXlkpdkOw.text: I'm sad that I don't live in Charlotte anymore because this is the best take out ever!  Their sesame chicken and crab rangoons are to die for!   I make sure to always get something from here when I come to visit, would definitely recommend!

Ql4anSWHv_Nqmma7WHto-A.text: For the last 17 years on Christmas Day, my family has gone to Shun Lee Palace - it was a reliable tradition in my small three-person family that we attached to - some level of continuity, and a dependable yearly thing to look forward to.  Over the years,  any service problems were eclipsed by the moment.  Some years  - we had way too many people, and had to pair down - somehow they came through to serve us, everyone was fed, etc.   Well, I'm afraid those days are over.   On Christmas Day, we had whittled down our party to our family of three, and another family of three - total of six, including one 11 year old and one toddler.  We tried to get reservations, but they weren't taking them this time, so we just rolled with it anyway, they sat us quickly.   We sat for a few minutes, then I waived down the attention of the waiter, we ordered drinks, appetizers, meals.  And we waited.  Drinks came, some appetizers came. 30 minutes became an hour.  Then the appetizers came again. (What? eat them anyway?  okay...)  Then an hour and fifteen, we began looking at each other - no check in from the waiter - some folks who worked there were milling around the bar, rearranging glassware, no food came out.  Appetizers came out again?   Anyway - long story short 2 hours went by, no food came out, our Xmas dinner effectively sort of ruined.   Its always been slightly chaotic at the holiday, but this was down to just insulting.   We left 20 bucks to cover the booze and the appetizers and the wait staff to some degree who clearly were at the mercy of the kitchen.   Oh well. 17 years was a good run I guess.  We went home, fuming, foodless,  and frustrated - my family sad, in particular my dejected wife at yet another low point of 2016.

SZqi-fariJ3RhTgTLParVg.text: Well, I am glad to share the food quality has returned to Shun Lee Palace. Service and food has returned to where near Frank had always kept it. We have enjoyed the improvement for the last couple years.

mdZjyTqeAsXlS8mOA6umBg.text: Just had the worst take-out experience ever with this place, and I've had some mediocre ones in the past here. Ordered three entrees on-line via beyondmenu.com. When I arrived to pick up my food, having given them 25 minutes to prepare it, I sat for another 10 minutes until it was ready (along with 4 other patrons who all appeared tired of waiting too long despite the fact that there was only one table seated in the restaurant). I looked at the ticket and noticed one of the entrees was entered incorrectly and asked the person at the bar about it. She assured me it was correct based on my order. When I got home, I opened my bag to find only two entrees, one of which was the wrong item I had brought to their attention at the restaurant. I returned to Shun Lee with the incorrect entree and it took me raising my voice on the third attempt to tell her what I actually ordered in addition to a printout of my order to get things right. When I asked for a refund, she said she couldn't do that. When I asked to speak to a manager, she stated there wasn't one on duty. This place has gone down hill dramatically since the Yao family sold it. We will never be back!!

BsrL48bQ1Qugvyi87SZslg.text: The waiter decided to charge extra and give himself a $19 tip. Then put it in the receipt as a service charge and added whatever else he wanted. Highly disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States. Highly disappointed!!

Xvlg7foAzJlqC62cE4_Ofw.text: Heres the skinny on great Chinese dining on Charlotte, this is the place to eat and enjoy a nice elegant Chinese meal. This place has been in Charlotte for as long as I can remember and if you didn't work on Colwick or drive down it everyday, you wouldn't know the place existed.  They don't advertise much at all and there really is no signage.  To be honest the outside is pretty stale.  But come inside and the atmosphere will blow you away.  You will think you are downtown or in Southpark.  No kidding!     Let me get some grub in my belly and I will lay it out for ya.  Update.  The owner comes over and asks how is everything and makes small talk. -customer service five stars  Soup was great I got the wonton soup to give it a whirl and loved it.    Crab ragoons, oh the crab ragoons!    I love these things and they have the best in charlotte hands down.   Spring rolls were good, and these things they called shrimp toast were ok.  I didnt know what to expect since I had never heard of shrimp toast but wth right?   Live a little.  I really dont know how to describe them. Soy cake with ground shrimp maybe?   They were a good appetizer and I actually like the flavor but the texture threw me through a loop.   Try em, let me know what you think....  Dinner comes right on time.  I dont give a crap what anybody says about food too long too early too whatever. My food, came out perfectly timed and the waiter was on point.   Oh dinner...  8 chicken, chicken 8,  something like that with brown rice.  Nom nom nom.   Excellent stuff.    So now I sit, on my couch, belly full of really great chinese and all I can say is this, my fortune cookie fortune was lame reslly lame, but the service, food, and atmosphere was freaking Awesome!    Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States. Duh, #8 how can you not try this place?

-ls2BPHhIVvQe0fcGFnexQ.text: We lived near Shun Lee for a few years and it was our go-to for Chinese. It wasn't until after we moved further away that we realized that it was much better than most quick Chinese restaurants. The dumplings are some of the best we've had in Charlotte. My fiance also only gets chicken wings and dumplings so he swears that Shun Lee has the best chicken wings for a Chinese restaurant. I doubt Shun Lee wants to be known for chicken wings, but they are for us!   I've ordered most things on their menu and I haven't been disappointed with them. It's definitely not a gourmet Chinese restaurant and I've heard it's not especially authentic, but if you want quick and inexpensive Chinese, you should give it a try!

bkNaHdQwvWDrwPIOBtp5-A.text: Sadly when I compare it to what it used to be, it isn't even a one star. This was one of the best. I have had their crispy scallops. And they were great. Today the garlic sauce scallops were fishy tasting and tough. I don't know what changed. But new menus, and unfortunately s severe downgrade in food

Pwth14rO075Q9oOWnrmyhw.text: Shun Lee Palace has been a family go-to for many years. I grew up not far from the restaurant and we often visited the restaurant for both dine-in and carry-out. You can always count on some yummy food when you go here. Restaurant is clean and inviting and service is quick and friendly.

KOFKHx7EPDbeQu2XexT_vw.text: My family loves Shun Lee Palace. Such a quick easy option for lazy Sunday nights or week nights the kids have soccer practice. Best Chinese on this side of town and you cannot beat the service. I've had issues with Chinese restaurants in the past getting my orders very wrong and there is never a problem here. I recommend taking a look at their dinner specials as they are very affordable for a large family such as mine%

ksqdco9q3ryPVu47mOtO_g.text: I was excited to try this Chinese restaurant because the menu and inside brought back old memories of great Chinese places I've been before. I love how QUIET it is in here .   This visit I got a lunch special of shrimp and rice , the flavor was great, but the food did not come out as hot as I would have liked. I found myself getting full very quickly as well.

u4UJFzeveHzGsnx0aW5mpQ.text: Shun Lee is an absolute favorite "hands down"!!!  Each entree is special, one of my favorites in Charlotte. Added, SLP provides brown rice as an option for no additional charge.  Serving associates are always attentive, courteous and accommodating.  An all time favorite!

mSOi18TXX-zzYOodB-qNyw.text: Ehhh I hated that I cheated on my fav Chinese place but I was closest to this place. I should have opted out on a different place. I got the sa cha shrimp and it was so oily!  The server that served me burped as she was finishing chewing on food when bringing my tea. Everyone likes their own Chinese places but I didn't like my visit here. I had to find someone to get my check and a to go box- even though I didn't like it. Maybe I might try again at a good lunch time and not after lunch rush.

MtvyIjmyLHSSTFGV-Tdqaw.text: I've never been crazy about their food but was never unpleased enough to write a review but....After placing a order on their website and receiving a confirmation email.  Calling because I noticed I had one number off on the delivery address, they didn't state they didn't have a order.  30 minutes past the time it was supposed to be delivered I called and they said they never got a order and that they were closing.

iQm_M5kmiXjTY_Nc8mpxrA.text: Located in a strip mall, parking spaces are very small!    Came for lunch on a Friday afternoon, no wait for a table or booth.  They've updated the look of their menu, along with that came price increases for their plates.     Service was good, absolutely no complaints there.  The gentleman who was our server has been there for YEARS and is always pleasant.    Our food came out within ten minutes of ordering.  Food portions have decreased and the taste and flavor is no longer there.  I've always CRAVED their Sesame Chicken because it was semi crispy and had a honey flavor it to.  No longer the case. I Ordered Sesame Chicken, which came with fried rice and egg roll but it wasn't good.  The sauce for the Sesame Chicken has been changed and I'm not a fan. The rice lacked flavor, was clumpy and portions of it weren't well mixed. The egg rolls have also decreased in size.   Restrooms need updating.  They are older, although clean the ladies room had the weirdest, foulest odor - perhaps a plumbing issue.

photos.caption: Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States. Clumpy Rice

7vrsPGJ4_ayqMF1XqPvoYQ.text: Visit date 12/12/17  It's been a while since I ate from Shun Lee Place, BUT I can say this, it's not the same. I made a carry out order. BIG MISTAKE I SHOULD HAVE CALLED IT IN FOR PICK UP! My order took 45 MINS!!!! Mind you I was in lunch break and only get an hour. So when I get my food it was cold!!! But how?? So In another words my food did not take 45 mins, you just had it sitting! I was disappointed with the service!!!!! The was taste BUT COLD.  The was rice was hard and warm!!!!   parking is bad also they must be doing something to the parking lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States. My cold honey dew shrimp

7qDRS8u3oeRX34fnC7uf-A.text: Growing up this was the Chinese restaurant we would go to for every occasion. My aunt used to go here during college and sit at their bar to study while at Queens. Fair to say Shun Lee has a special place in my heart. As such, I was super excited to see they had a Groupon last fall. On my last day in the city thought I would try to use it and boy was it a disaster. Ordered three dishes since they wouldn't let me order takeout but I needed to use the $30 value at lunch. Crispy orange shrimp - sauce was gross straight out of a jar, fried rice was white rice with soy sauce. Singaporean noodles had zero flavor and low quality chicken meat. The only saving Grace was the sauteed eggplant that was honestly amazing! Frustrating that the food has gone so down hill and the service was also horrible. No water refills, questioned twice about my large order. Just awkward.

3SoeBoVg2GCxkxkmbYnsVg.text: Lunch today with a group from church.  There were about 15 of us.  They took our orders very efficiently and had the food coming out within ten minutes.  Amazing service.  As soon as we ate, our plates were cleared and the individual checks arrived at the table.  Complete efficiency all the way around. I can understand why people love this restaurant so much.  The atmosphere is calming and quiet.  The staff makes you feel welcomed and taken care of.  I had the Moo Goo Gai Pan lunch special.  It was okay; could have been a little more flavorful and definitely served hotter.  What they missed with that, they made up in efficiency.  My bet is that if I return there with another person or two, it would be a different experience than what I had with a large group of people.  For Chinese food in Charlotte, this is probably the place.  It feels like a mom and pop restaurant that is locally owned.  While there is definitely a place for PF CHANGS, I prefer supporting places that are not as grandiose and more home grown.   For that reason, I will be back to this restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States

Prb7omLnTCCW7sisZJ8E4A.text: I thought I would give them another chance. Ordered Singapore Noodles. The familiar taste was not there. No heat from the crushed red pepper, no taste/color from the curry. Boiled noodles a few pieces of chicken, three shrimp, no spices. I would like to see who's doing the cooking! And where is Michael? Does he still own this place? I've been a customer since 1987.  Time to move on.

kch6KFnqbkvVO1yFbkn7gw.text: Hadn't had Shun Lee in years but remembered liking it so I ordered it through postmates tonight. Almost our entire order was wrong, and what wasn't was just subpar. I ordered a chicken, shrimp, and beef noodle bowl and instead got two bowls: one of a foul smelling soup with beef, peas, and broccoli (no other meat), and the other with room temp unseasoned spaghetti noodles. Even just the beef from the soup was slimy chewy and inedible. The chicken was far from fresh and the fried rice with it was instead just plain white rice. I'm glad I have a totinos pizza in the freezer but that won't get my $30 back.

k_HcAewL9To50lKtydDJ_Q.text: Building had an odd smell upon entering. I ordered the crispy duck appetizer and Singapore noodles . I was not a fan of the duck nor the noodles . I was pretty disappointed that the duck didn't come with it's own sauce  and the general presentation of it . Everything was just disappointing .

photos.caption: Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Shun Lee Palace - Charlotte, NC, United States

cMTyHNpYln6O8fJwtNL2Pw.text: Hmm. It's hard not to feel bad for this place. Located in an older plaza, you just know that this was probably the place you went when you wanted Chinese on this side of town. Now, I think these older single entree places don't have a chance against the buffet on Independence. I got the beef Lo-mein (pictured). Nice portion. I liked the thinner noodle (beef was mainly on the bottom) but really, no flavor. Bright side, the hot and sour soup was one of the best I've had. Service was actually pretty good too. But the atmosphere, ugh. There was a woman 4 tables away reading all the negative Yelp reviews out loud to the owner telling her she worked with a company that could delete them. Talk about a depressing background to your meal. (Lady, if you read this, you own a CBD retail shop. I know because we got to enjoy every word of your 20 minute sales call).

XCpl-4smz7M-fLTjS7lXDg.text: I attempted to give his place another try for lunch one weekday.  Needless to say, I walked in and walked back out.   There was caution tape up and a horrible smell.  The sanitation rating was at an all time low.  I was a little sad and really disappointed.  I wanted to try them again, give them a second chance, but it just seems they may be getting worse rather than better.

dI1DDl-aLyfqNa5ntaT6PA.text: I've been coming here practically my entire life. It's always been great. The food is delicious and the staff is always very efficient and friendly. This is a hidden gem

HcExh_iHdoGGanP_gZndZQ.text: This place has really gonna down hill.  5 years ago this was one of the better chinese places in Charlotte. Now the good quality has declined by a lot & the cleanliness of the bathrooms is horrible. The last time we went in September 2018 the bathrooms had a sign about not flushing toilet paper down the toilet and, as a result, the bathroom smelled horrible and the floors were wet.  We will not being going back.

oFdpzrbdT_4JEYhjSw9qnA.text: This place deserves much better reviews than the ones I see here. We get takeout from here often and the dishes always taste wonderful, the staff is friendly, and the food is prepared in a timely matter.

1G3JeHCHeSHihjJiCIc0pA.text: I ordered my food .....hour and 30 minutes went by and I called to check on my food the lady told me that my food has yet to left the kitchen and that the driver had other orders! Keep in mind that I called before this call and asked if my food had been sent out and she told me that it has gone out. She rudely asked if i wanted to cancel my order and then told me to be patient!! Like I think I was patient enough waiting for 2 hours for a plate of food! The service is horrible and they need training and a new receptionist.....If I could leave a -20 star I would. Will never order from this place again.

gZ8CQo-FPPq-MYiUJyO3lw.text: Literally the worst Chinese food I've ever had.  Had the taste (bland) and consistency (frozen reheated breaded General Tso's) that was awful.    Will never order again.  Ordered again.  Tried a different dish.  On a  scale of 0 to 5 would give it a 2.  Is supposedly "spicy", but it had zero spice.  Bottom line:  not worth your money.

8jVt9mICvr0Wgxz83EdNPw.text: My coworkers and I order from here all the time. The food we've ordered have all been pretty good but it's not amazing. I usually get spicy beef chow fun. Its my favorite because not a lot of chinese places serve beef chow fun. I haven't dined in yet but the decor is decent and I like that they do serve alcohol.

45ph0BHCmuMOpnDHF3OrEg.text: Kind of overpriced b/c they're the only Chinese restaurant in Cotswold. Service use to be great but has really declined in the last few months. Long lines on weekend, order mix ups and homeless people hanging out in the waiting room. We no longer eat here.

DOhHAJGtLGeD7ZzCQ26bPQ.text: Went on Christmas day, after my group was told that there was a 1.5 hour wait at another Chinese restaurant we had intended to go to.  4 of the 8 guests ordered appetizers, which never arrived - well, they arrived, but not until about 20 minutes after the entrees were served, after speaking to the waiter and the manager numerous times.  I get that they were busy, but I'm sure this isn't their first Christmas day of being one of the few restaurants in the city open.  Ordered the Ma Po Tofu, which was decent, but I was wondering what peas and mini carrot squares (either from a can, or someone has amazingly precise dicing skills) were doing there.  We ordered white and brown rice for the table, but they only brought brown rice.  Once the 8 of us quickly finished that off, it took them another 5-10 minutes to bring out more rice.  Service was a mess, and the manager seemed to be as lackadaisical as the waiter was, when we pointed out that the appetizers and parts of the meals had not been brought out.  At least they comped the appetizers, but based on the service, I don't think I'll be back.

licjn03c-AQPt9UAwusLVA.text: The best thing about Shun lee palace aside from the fact that its super close to my house is the food. Chinese food is a hit or a miss almost everywhere. Shun lee palace is a lil on the pricier side but its worth it. The sauces in the dishes don't have a typical chinese food thick consistency that I hate!! The meats are all very flavorful and the fried rice is so yum. I've only had lunch there but one of these days I plan on going for dinner. I'll add on to this review at that time ;o)
